publication.title: MPLAB® Harmony 3 USB Device application examples

url.title: 1 Harmony 3 USB Device application examples
url.description: MPLAB® Harmony 3 is an extension of the MPLAB® ecosystem for creating embedded firmware solutions for Microchip 32-bit SAM and PIC® microcontroller and microprocessor devices. Refer to the following ...

url.title: 1.1 CDC COM Port Dual Example (cdc_com_port_dual)
url.description: This application demonstrates the ability of the MPLAB Harmony USB Device Stack to support multiple instances of the same device class. It creates a USB CDC Device that enumerates as two serial ports ...

url.title: 1.2 CDC COM Port Single Example (cdc_com_port_single)
url.description: This application demonstrates the ability of the MPLAB Harmony USB Device Stack to support USB Communication Device Class. It demonstrates two-way communication between the USB device and the USB ...

url.title: 1.3 CDC MSD Basic Example (cdc_msd_basic)
url.description: This application demonstrates the ability of the MPLAB Harmony USB Device Stack to support Composite USB Device Description This application creates a USB CDC Device that enumerates as a COM port and ...

url.title: 1.4 CDC MSD SD Card Example (cdc_msd_sdcard)
url.description: This application demonstrates the ability of the MPLAB Harmony USB Device Stack to support composite USB Device. Description This application creates a USB CDC Device that enumerates as a COM port ...

url.title: 1.5 CDC Serial Emulator Example (cdc_serial_emulator)
url.description: This application demonstrates the ability of the MPLAB Harmony USB Device Stack to support CDC Device Class using a real-world application. It implements a CDC USART Serial Emulator application. ...

url.title: 1.6 CDC Serial Emulator MSD Example (cdc_serial_emulator_msd)
url.description: This demonstration application creates a USB composite device that combines the functionality of the cdc_serial_emulator and msd_basic demonstration applications. Description This application ...

url.title: 1.7 HID Basic Example (hid_basic)
url.description: This application demonstrates the ability of the MPLAB Harmony USB Device Stack to support custom HID device class. This custom HID device can be controlled by a PC-based utility. Description This ...

url.title: 1.8 HID Basic Remote Wakeup Example (hid_basic_remote_wakeup)
url.description: This application demonstrates the ability of the MPLAB® Harmony USB Device Stack to support the Remote Wakeup feature using a custom HID device class example. Description This application creates a ...

url.title: 1.9 HID Joystick Example (hid_joystick)
url.description: This application demonstrates the ability of the MPLAB Harmony USB Device Stack to support custom HID joystick. Description This demonstration application creates a custom HID joystick. This ...

url.title: 1.10 HID Keyboard Example (hid_keyboard)
url.description: This application demonstrates the ability of the MPLAB Harmony USB Device Stack to support Generic HID keyboard. Description This demonstration application creates a Generic HID keyboard. Pressing a ...

url.title: 1.11 HID Mouse Example (hid_mouse)
url.description: This application demonstrates the ability of the MPLAB Harmony USB Device Stack to support HID based two-button mouse device. Description This demonstration application creates a USB HID based ...

url.title: 1.12 HID MSD Basic Example (hid_msd_basic)
url.description: This application demonstrates the ability of the MPLAB Harmony USB Device Stack to support USB composite device. Description This demonstration application creates a USB Device that combines the ...

url.title: 1.13 MSD Basic Example (msd_basic)
url.description: This application demonstrates the ability of the MPLAB Harmony USB Device Stack to support USB Mass Storage Device. The application uses MCU's NVM region as storage media. Description This ...

url.title: 1.14 MSD Multiple LUN Example (msd_multiple_luns)
url.description: This application demonstrates data transfer between two storage media - SD card and non-volatile memory (NVM) - and a computer through USB Mass Storage Device (MSD). Description This application ...

url.title: 1.15 MSD SD Card Example (msd_sdcard)
url.description: This application demonstrates the ability of the MPLAB Harmony USB Device Stack to support USB Mass Storage Device. The application uses SD Card as storage media. Description This application creates ...

url.title: 1.16 Printer Example (printer)
